sen.j: 姉川地震（あねがわじしん）は、1909年（明治42年）8月14日午後3時31分、滋賀県北東部の姉川付近（北緯35.4度、東経136.3度）を震源として発生した地震。
sen.e: The Ane-gawa River Earthquake occurred in August 14, 1909 at 3:31pm with its seismic center near Ane-gawa River in the North East part in Shiga Prefecture (at latitude 35.4 degrees north and longitude 136.3 degrees east.)

The Ane-gawa River Earthquake occurred in August 14, 1909 at 3:31pm with its seismic center near Ane-gawa River in the North East part in Shiga Prefecture (at latitude 35.4 degrees north and longitude 136.3 degrees east.)

The Ane-gawa River Earthquake occurred in August 14, 1909 at 3:31pm with its seismic center near Ane-gawa River in the North East part in Shiga Prefecture (at latitude 35.4 degrees north and longitude 136.3 degrees east.)

sen.j: 滋賀県から福井県にかけて、北北西方向にのびる柳ヶ瀬断層が活動したと考えられている。
sen.e: It might be caused by the movement of the Yanagase fault expanding toward north-northwest from Shiga Prefecture to Fukui Prefecture.
It is thought that it was caused by the movement of the Yanagase fault expanding toward north-northwest from Shiga Prefecture to Fukui Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 「と考えられている」の訳し方を変更しました。
sen.e: It is thought that it was caused by the movement of the Yanagase fault expanding toward north-northwest from Shiga Prefecture to Fukui Prefecture.

sen.j: 地震の規模を示すマグニチュードは6.8。
sen.e: The magnitude that shows a scale of the earthquake was 6.8.
The magnitude that shows a scale of the earthquake was 6.8.
The magnitude that shows a scale of the earthquake was 6.8.

sen.j: 現在の滋賀県東浅井郡虎姫町で最大の震度6、滋賀県内全域で震度5〜4を記録した。
sen.e: The earthquake registered on the intensity of 6 on the Japanese scale of 7 as the maximum in the current Torahime-cho, Higashiazai District in Shiga Prefecture, and the intensity of 5-4 in the all of Shiga Prefecture.

The earthquake measured six on the seven-point Japanese scale in the current Torahime-cho, Higashiazai District in Shiga Prefecture, where it hit the hardest, and five to four in all areas in Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 全体的に修正しました。
sen.e: The earthquake measured six on the seven-point Japanese scale in the current Torahime-cho, Higashiazai District in Shiga Prefecture, where it hit the hardest, and five to four in all areas in Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 東北地方南部から九州地方の一部にかけての広い範囲で有感地震が観測され、被害は滋賀県と岐阜県に及んだ。
sen.e: The noticeable earthquake was monitored in a wide area from the south of Tohoku Region to some part of Kyushu Region, its damage hit Shiga Prefecture and Gifu Prefecture.
The noticeable earthquake was monitored in a wide area from the south of Tohoku Region to some part of Kyushu Region, and its damage hit Shiga Prefecture and Gifu Prefecture.
sen.cmt: and で文をつなぎました。
sen.e: The noticeable earthquake was monitored in a wide area from the south of Tohoku Region to some part of Kyushu Region, and its damage hit Shiga Prefecture and Gifu Prefecture.

sen.j: そのため、「江濃地震」とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: So that it has another name called 'Kono Earthquake'.
Therefore, it is also called 'Kono Earthquake,' where Ko (江) means Omi (近江) Province (old name of Shiga Prefecture) and No (濃) means Mino (美濃) Province (old name of Gifu Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 「江濃」の説明を入れましたが、これでよろしいでしょうか。
sen.e: Therefore, it is also called 'Kono Earthquake,' where Ko (江) means Omi (近江) Province (old name of Shiga Prefecture) and No (濃) means Mino (美濃) Province (old name of Gifu Prefecture).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: 直下型地震であったため、被害は滋賀県と岐阜県に集中した。
sen.e: As it was the inland earthquake, Shiga Prefecture and Gifu Prefecture were hit the most serious damages.
As it was an inland earthquake, Shiga Prefecture and Gifu Prefecture were hit the most serious damages.
As it was an inland earthquake, Shiga Prefecture and Gifu Prefecture were hit the most serious damages.

sen.j: 滋賀県では、死者35名、負傷者643名、全壊2192戸、半壊5985戸を出した。
sen.e: In Shiga Prefecture, the number of the dead person was 35, the injured was 643, the houses completely destroyed was 2192, and partially destroyed was 5985.
In Shiga Prefecture, the death toll was 35, 643 were injured, 2192 houses were completely destroyed, and 5985 houses were partially destroyed.
sen.cmt: 表現を少し変更しました。
sen.e: In Shiga Prefecture, the death toll was 35, 643 were injured, 2192 houses were completely destroyed, and 5985 houses were partially destroyed.

sen.j: その中でも大きな被害を出したのが虎姫村（現・虎姫町）で、人的被害は死者17名、負傷者53名。
sen.e: The most damaged area in the prefecture was Torahime Village (current Torahime-cho) with 17 dead person and 53 injured person as human damage.
The most damaged area in the prefecture was Torahime Village (current Torahime-cho) with 17 dead and 53 injured as human damage.
sen.cmt: 表現を少し変更しました。
sen.e: The most damaged area in the prefecture was Torahime Village (current Torahime-cho) with 17 dead and 53 injured as human damage.

sen.j: さらに、全戸数991戸のうち全壊284戸､半壊518戸を出している。
sen.e: Furthermore, 284 houses were completely destroyed and 518 were partially destroyed out of 991 houses in the village.
Furthermore, 284 houses were completely destroyed and 518 were partially destroyed out of 991 houses in the village.
Furthermore, 284 houses were completely destroyed and 518 were partially destroyed out of 991 houses in the village.

sen.j: また、岐阜県でも岐阜市西部で死者6名、重傷者18名を出し、全壊51戸、半壊138戸であった。
sen.e: In Gifu Prefecture, 6 people died, 18 people injured, 51 houses were completely destroyed and 138 houses were partially destroyed in the West of Gifu City.
In Gifu Prefecture, 6 people were killed, 18 people were injured, 51 houses were completely destroyed and 138 houses were partially destroyed in the West of Gifu City.
sen.cmt: 表現を少し変更しました。
sen.e: In Gifu Prefecture, 6 people were killed, 18 people were injured, 51 houses were completely destroyed and 138 houses were partially destroyed in the West of Gifu City.

sen.j: 総被害は、死者41名、負傷者784名、全壊2243戸、半壊6503戸、山崩れ70箇所であった。
sen.e: The total damages were, 41 dead person, 784 injury, 2243 completely destroyed houses, 6503 partially destroyed houses, and 70 spots of the landslides.
The total damages were, 41 deaths, 784 injuries, 2243 completely destroyed houses, 6503 partially destroyed houses, and 70 landslides.
sen.cmt: 表現を少し変更しました。
sen.e: The total damages were, 41 deaths, 784 injuries, 2243 completely destroyed houses, 6503 partially destroyed houses, and 70 landslides.

sen.j: また、伊吹山の斜面の一部が崩落。
sen.e: A part of the slope of Mt. Ibuki was collapsed.
A part of the slope of Mt. Ibuki was collapsed.
A part of the slope of Mt. Ibuki was collapsed.

sen.j: 姉川河口の川底が数十ｍ沈降し、琵琶湖では高さ1.8ｍの波が押し寄せた。
sen.e: The bottom of the Ane-gawa River estuary subsided tens of meters, and the waves of 1.8 meters high surged in Lake Biwa.
The bottom of the Ane-gawa River estuary subsided tens of meters, and the waves of 1.8 meters high surged in Lake Biwa.
The bottom of the Ane-gawa River estuary subsided tens of meters, and the waves of 1.8 meters high surged in Lake Biwa.

sen.j: 三角洲でも6個の穴から泥水が2.5ｍ噴出するなどの地変が観測された。
sen.e: The diastrophism such as the gush of 2.5 meter high muddy water from 6 holes in the delta was observed.
Diastrophisms such as the gush of 2.5 meter high muddy water from 6 holes in the delta were observed.
Diastrophisms such as the gush of 2.5 meter high muddy water from 6 holes in the delta were observed.
